metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1813 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in Extensions in Google Chrome prior to 112.0.5615.49 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to bypass file access restrictions via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 112.0.5615.49-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 112.0.5615.49-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 112.0.5615.49-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 112.0.5615.49-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 112.0.5615.49-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0.5615.49-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
